alert.note: Alert for Chouteau (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 08 at 5:21PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following counties, Blaine, Chouteau and Hill. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 519 PM MDT, Local law enforcement and Montana Department of Transportation reported snowmelt that was leading to flooding in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Havre, Chinook, Big Sandy, Harlem, Parker School, Agency, Azure, Sangrey, St. Pierre, Beaver Creek, Boneau, Fort Belknap, Box Elder, Hays, Lloyd, Cleveland, Lohman, Rocky Boy, Zurich and Laredo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
